problem_summary_simple: Check if a binary tree follows alternating even/odd level value and ordering rules.
problem_summary_technical: Perform BFS, validating node values at each level for parity and strictly increasing/decreasing order.
time_complexity: O(n) where n is the number of nodes
space_complexity: O(w) where w is the maximum width of the tree (for the queue)
key_insights: Level-order traversal (BFS) is essential to process nodes level by level.
Maintain a flag to track whether the current level should have odd or even values.
For each level, check both the parity of values and the strictly increasing/decreasing order.
Keep track of the previous node's value within a level for order checking.
